required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Programmed Death-1 (PD-1) Antibody Combined With Chemoradiotherapy in High-risk Recurrent Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: PD-1 Antibody Combined With Chemotherapy in High-risk Recurrent Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma: a Prospective, Open, Single-arm Phase II Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This is a a prospective, single-arm phase II clinical trial. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and adverse effect of PD-1 antibody with chemotherapy in high-risk recurrent nasopharyngeal carcinoma.

primary_outcome.time_frame: After 3 cycles of GP chemothrapy plus PD-1 antibody (each cycle is 21 days)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 3 cycles of GP chemothrapy plus PD-1 antibody (each cycle is 21 days)

secondary_outcome.description: From date of recruitment to disease progression
From date of recruitment to disease progression

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 months
through whole study, an average of 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluating with questionnaire of EuroQoL 5 dimension, 5 level health state utility index (EQ-5D-5L)

intervention.description: Toripalimab is an antibody targeting PD-1 developed by Shanghai Junshi Biosciences Co., Ltd.

link.description: Home Page of Sun Yat-sen University Cancer Center
